reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Dec 07 - My wife & I have just returned after a week staying half board at the Oasis Duna in Corralejo.
reviews.title: Does exactly what it says on the tin

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is a box standard 3 * (dont beleive some websites that claim 4*), working class, tourist hotel that does exactly what it says on the tin !
reviews.title: It suited us just fine!

likes.liked: — sunny,peaceful, balcony, overlooking palm trees. and good food.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It's located on the outskirts of fast expanding Corralejo, approx 10 - 15 mins from the Beach & old town (all 4 streets of it), but right across the Rd from the Waterpark (the only one on the Island apparently)
reviews.title: Had a Great Holiday

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Rooms are clean & tidy (if a little dated & tired) with a good bathroom and shower & a kitchenette with a toaster, 2 ring Hob & a Fridge.
reviews.title: El Cotillo Lagoons

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There is a TV (14" colour) in the living area, but this will cost you €6 per day (€45 per week). There's also a safe - but again this is extra - €15 per week (I think)
reviews.title: We have been twice, 2nd time not as good

reviews.text: We travelled in a group of 12, 6 adults and 6 kids ages 9 months, 2 yrs, 4yrs, 5yrs, 9yrs and 12yrs. Our main problem when we arrived late wednesday night was the lack of consideration from the hotel as we requested a pool view GROUND FLOOR as we had small children and 2 pushchairs and when we arrived they put us round the back opposite a road and up a flight of steep steeps! when we asked to be moved the staff just said fully booked come back saturday but couldnt guarantee
reviews.title: No consideration!

reviews.text: anything but as we were only there for a week we decided between us we would have to manage, but what was annoying was watching couples and families with much older children checking into the rooms beneath
reviews.title: Definitley the best choice

likes.liked: — The abundance of loungers by the amazing pool!
likes.disliked: — the lack of ventiliation in the bathroom

reviews.text: us!!!
reviews.title: Excellect holiday!

reviews.text: The rooms didnt have a microwave to heat baby food up and the rooms were very hot and stuffy.
reviews.title: Thin walls tell many stories

likes.liked: — You got what you paid for
likes.disliked: — Thin walls, balconies not private enough, expensive over-priced supermarket on site

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Then on our departure we had a night flight so we asked to keep the rooms on or at least 1 out of the 3 and the staff just said no fully booked, we explained that we had a baby and small children and they just said no chance fully booked! so we checked out at 12 and when i needed to change my baby it was then i realized there wasnt 1 single baby change facility! so i had to use the toilet floor! how bads that

likes.liked: — The location was very good & enjoyed the pool bar

reviews.title: Would go Back

likes.liked: — The rooms were very big and clean compared to other Spanish destinations

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Aside from problems from the tour operator (Mytravel - 5hr delay to fly, booked us in wrong hotel, the list goes on ....) - our holiday was a quiet one.
reviews.title: Excellent Appartments

likes.liked: — Lovely appartments and nice swimming pools

reviews.text: As most recent reviewers had said - the hotel is large - almost maze-like with an inner ring where the pool is and two further rings for each set of apartments. Anyway you get a map you check in so you soon remember where the main parts are anyway.
reviews.title: Brilliant relaxing week

likes.liked: — Lovely pool area, clean appartments, great staff.
likes.disliked: — not too much to do for teenagers

reviews.text: The hotel was pleasant. Very clean (rooms cleaned/towels changed 5 times a week with linen 2 times a week.) Staff very friendly especially if you give them the ol' espanol - they love it when you speak to them in their own language as some guests seem to intimidate or at least don't have the patience with some of the staff with lesser vocal skills.
reviews.title: great for kids

likes.disliked: — needs a refurb, no air con

reviews.text: This was our fourth visit to Corralejo and we love it ! For families it is a beautiful, clean and safe resort with no large groups of clubbers or larger louts in sight, yet, it still has plenty to do to keep you occupied with the kids. The beaches are out of this world and clearly match any carribean beach I have visited in my time. Try to ensure that you visit the magnificant beach at the dunes as a trip to this resort wld be wasted without it. Due to the fact we love beach life, we visited the dunes 3 out of 7 days. The actual complex is very good, with an excellant pool, probably one of the more larger freeforms I have seen, and the gardens are kept clean. There are lots of children at this complex so older couples and younger couples with no kids seeking peace and quiet should go elsewhere. Oasis Dunas are the best complex in the resort for kids and also the best laid out, the pools alone are worth it and they are very clean. Only downside is the Apartments themselves inside, they are very basic and could do with a refurb, we found them to be very stuffy so rent a fan, but they are cleaned almost every day and are very clean, but because the complex is so lovely it kind of takes the focus off the basic apartments. Eating out is great as almost all of the restaurants are fantastic, I rarely hear anyone complain about the food in this resort and there is a lot of competition but here are my faves... For great Seafood and fresh Fish try any of the restaurants in the harbour, they are all good and you can sit outside and gaze across the sea, For Steak, Pasta or Pizza Don Camillos in the main strip is gorgeous !! The best Chinese is Slow Boat 2, which is in the plaza and trust me, there is a lot of Slow Boat restaurants in the resort but none of them are as good as this one and if you like an Indian, ALL the three Indians in the resort are very good, they are all authentic and freshly prepared.
reviews.title: Beautiful Fuerteventura

likes.liked: — The pools, cleanliness, gardens, location, kids entertainment
likes.disliked: — The basic apartment interior and lack of air conditioning

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There is a great Mexican in the old town which you will need directions for, dont try the one in the Plaza as this is expensive and not very good at all !! Wasnt impressed by Tony Romas, quite expensive and not as good as the ones back home. The majority of all the steakhouses are excellant and I hear the new one in the Plaza is lovely, also, Poco Loco does fantastic steak, chicken, seafood etc and La Terraza steak House is fantastic with really great prices !!
reviews.title: Excellent Accomodation!

likes.liked: — Perfect "base-camp" for beaches, exploring, shopping and nightlife

reviews.text: Try and visit the harbour at night, it is quaint and beautiful and you get to see the original Corraejo, also try Music Square in the harbour area for great acts, live music and most of the restaurants in Music Square are very good indeed, great to be if you like to be entertained whilst dining in the open air !!
reviews.title: Had a fantastic holiday
nice pools
reviews.text: If you have kids the Waterpark is a must, a little expensive but then arnt they all ! It is new and I believe if you head up after 3pm it is cheaper and less packed. The Animal Experience just beside it is very good, the kids will love it, and then for night time just up past the Animal Experience is " la Parque Europe", this is a Fun Themed Park for the kids which has free entry and then you pay onto the rides, but it isnt expensive. We used to get a taxi from outside the Rock Bar after dinner up to the park most nights to keep our 3 yr old happy. There are rides, bouncys, playgrounds and adventure experiences for all ages. There is also the "Hotel Del Terror", which is a walk through haunted house experience and I challenge anyone not to find this terrifying, not for the faint hearted but it is brilliant and would put the haunted house experience in Disneyland to shame ! Anyway I hope I have gave enough info for anyone visiting Oasis Duna, and I hope you will enjoy the Island, it is a beach lovers paradise with hot temperatures and great breezy winds to cool you down !! Enjoy !

Just landed home in Ireland about four hours ago after staying in the Oasis Dunas, Corralejo for the week. My girlfriend and I booked online with Panorama as a last-minute holiday and then we checked the reviews- some were quite worrying but as we found out, our worries were totally unfounded! The check-in staff were courteous and efficent and the reception area gave a great first impression. We were given a printed map of the complex on arrival and the receptionist circled the apartment on it. Our apartment was on the first floor so we had a nice view of the cactus gardens which were really cool! Inside the apartment it was spotlessly clean there. We had a bedroom (of course!), kitchenette, livingroom with a pullout sofa bed, bathroom and a furnished balcony. One major piece of advice is that you get a fan from reception as it gets really hot there. We didn't spend a huge amount of time in the complex apart from an hour or so by the pool on the second day as we prefered to get out and see what Corralejo has to offer but from what we could see the kids had good craic with the entertainment both day and night and there was plenty for the adults to do- a few bars, sport on TV in one bar. Looking out from the front of the reception building there's an unmissable view of the volcano which just proved to be too much temptation on Friday afternoon! There is also a laundry room in the complex which only costs €3 per machine and they take quite a large load but you have to get the token from reception and book a time so there won't be queues- make sure you bring washing powder youself though so save having to go back and forth to get some, yes, I made the mistake! This is getting a bit long so I'll stop but all-in-all we'd highly recommend Oasis Dunas to anyone.
reviews.title: Enjoyable experience by all
